meanings.definition: The act of shouting 'hello' or a similar greeting.
meanings.sent1: During the parade, the loud hilloing of the crowd could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent2: His cheerful hilloing across the street made everyone smile.
meanings.sent3: The hilloing of the excited children playing tag echoed through the park.
meanings.sent4: The hilloing of the birds at dawn signaled the start of a new day.
meanings.sent5: Her hilloing to her friends as they arrived at the party was filled with joy.

meanings.definition: The sound of a horn or trumpet.
meanings.sent1: The hilloing of the trumpet announced the arrival of the king.
meanings.sent2: The loud hilloing of the horn startled the sleeping deer in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The hilloing of the horn during the concert added a majestic touch to the music.
meanings.sent4: The hilloing of the horn in the distance signaled the start of the race.
meanings.sent5: The beautiful hilloing of the trumpet filled the hall with music.

meanings.definition: The act of calling out or hailing someone.
meanings.sent1: His hilloing for help could be heard by the lifeguard at the beach.
meanings.sent2: The loud hilloing of the lost child brought relief to the worried parents.
meanings.sent3: The hilloing of the coach for the players to gather signaled the start of practice.
meanings.sent4: The hilloing of the fans for their favorite team echoed through the stadium.
meanings.sent5: Her hilloing for her dog to come back made the neighbors smile.
